verses.verse: But Jesus went to the Mount of Olives.
At daybreak he arrived again in the temple, and all the people came to him. Then he sat down and taught them.
The scribes and Pharisees brought a woman to him who had been caught in adultery. After they had put her between them,
they said to him, "Master, this woman was caught in the very act of adultery.
"Now Moses in the law commanded us that such to be stoned, so what do you say?"
They said this craftily, testing him so they could accuse him, but Jesus stooped down and wrote on the ground with [his] finger.
And as they continued to ask him, he straightened up and said to them, "Let him who is sinless throw a stone at her."
And again he stooped down and wrote on the ground.
They heard this, and rebuked by their conscience, they left one by one starting at the oldest down to the last. Jesus alone was left along with the woman standing in the midst.
After Jesus straightened himself and saw no one but the woman, he said to her, "Woman, where are your accusers? Has no one condemned you?"
She said, "No one, sir". Jesus then said to her, "I don't condemned you either; go, and do not sin anymore."
Then Jesus spoke to them, saying, "I am the light of the world. The one who follows me will not walk in darkness but will have the light of life."
So the Pharisees said to him, "You are testifying about yourself; your testimony is not true."

Jesus answered and said to them, "Even though I testify about myself, my testimony is true, because I know where I came from and where I go, but you cannot figure out where I came from and where I am going.
"You pass judgment according to the flesh; I judge no one.
"But if I do judge, my judgment is true, for it is not only me but I and the Father who sent me.
"And in your own law it is written that the testimony of two people is true.
"I bear witness about myself; the Father who sent me also bears witness about me."
Then they said to him, "Where is your Father?" Jesus answered, "You do not know me or my Father, because if you had known me, you would have known my Father also."
Jesus spoke these words in the treasury as he taught in the temple, and no one arrested him, because his time had not come yet.
Then Jesus said to them again, "I am going away, and you will seek me and die in your sins. Where I am going, you cannot come".
Then the Jews said, "Is he going to kill himself? Is that why he says where I am going you cannot come?"
He is said to them, "You are from below; I am from above. You are from this world; I am not from this world.
"That's why I said to you, that you shall die in your sins, for if you don't believe that I Am, you shall die in your sins."
Then they said to him, "Who are you?" And Jesus said to them, "Even what I said to you from the beginning.
"I have many things to say and condemn you for, but he who sent is true, and I speak to the world those things which I have heard from him."
They didn't understand that he was talking about the Father.
Then Jesus said to them, "When you have lifted up the Son of Man, then you will know that I Am, and [that] I do nothing from myself, but even as the Father has taught me, so I speak these things.
"He who sent me is with me. The Father has not left me by myself, for I always do those things that please him."
While speaking these things, many believed in him.
Then Jesus said to the Jews who believed in him, "If you continue in my word, you are truly my disciples,
and you will know the truth, and the truth will set you free."
They answered him, "We are Abraham's descendants and were never in bondage to any one. How can you say, «You will be set free?»
Jesus answered them, "Very truly, I say to you that whoever commits sin is a slave of sin.
"And the slave does not remain in the house forever; the Son does remain forever.
"Therefore, if the Son sets you free, you will be really free.
"I know that you are Abraham's descendants, but you seek to kill me, because my word finds no place in you.
"I speak that which I have seen with my Father, and so you do that which you have seen with your father."
They answered and said to him, "Abraham is our father." Jesus said to them, "If you were Abraham's children, you would do the actions of Abraham.
"But now you seek to kill me, a man who has told you the truth, which I heard from God. Abraham did not do this.
"You do the actions of your father." Then they said to him, "We are not born by fornication; we have one Father--God."
Jesus said to them, "If God were your Father, you would love me, for I came from and came here from God, for I did not come on my own, but he sent me.
"Why don't you understand my speed? [It is] because you cannot hear my word.

"You are of [your] father, the devil, and you wish to do the lusts of your father. He was a murderer from the beginning, and has not stood in the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he tells a lie, he tells [it] from himself, because he is a liar and the father of it.
"But because I speak the truth, you do not believe me.
"Which of you finds me guilty of sin? If I tell the truth, why don't you believe me?
"The one who is of God hears God's words, the reason you don't hear it, [is] because you are not of God."
Then the Jews answered and said to him, "We said it well that you are a Samaritan and have a demon."
Jesus answered, "I do not have a demon. On the contrary, I honor my Father, but you dishonor me.
"I do not seek honor for my glory. There is one who is seeking [it] and judges.
"Very truly, I say to you: If any keeps my word, he will not see death ever."
Then the Jews said to him, "Now we know that you have a demon. Abraham is dead as well as the prophets, and you say: If any keeps my word, he will not see death ever.
"You are surely not greater than Abraham, who died, and the prophets who died. Who do you make yourself to be]?"
Jesus answered, "If I honor myself, my honor is nothing. It is my Father who honors me, of whom you say that he is your God.
"Yet you do not know him. If I were to say that I don't know him, I would be a liar like you. But I do know him and keep his word.
"Your father Abraham rejoiced that he would see my day, and he saw [it] and rejoiced."
Then the Jews said to him, "You are not yet fifty years old, and you have seen Abraham?"
Jesus said to them, "Very truly, I say to you: Before Abraham existed, I Am."
Then they picked up stones to throw at him, but Jesus concealed himself and left the Temple by going through the midst of them and so departed in this way.
